content:
After updating Lean I started getting a¬†bunch of strange errors from the codegen (because problem disappears if I mark vect.subst as a theorem). Here‚Äôs MWE of such one:

namespace MWE

universe u v w

inductive Id {A : Type u} : A ‚Üí A ‚Üí Type u
| refl {a : A} : Id a a

attribute [eliminator] Id.casesOn

infix:50 (priority := high) " = " => Id

inductive Unit : Type u
| star : Unit

attribute [eliminator] Unit.casesOn

notation "ùüè" => Unit
notation "‚òÖ" => Unit.star
notation "‚Ñï" => Nat

def vect (A : Type u) : ‚Ñï ‚Üí Type u
| Nat.zero   => ùüè
| Nat.succ n => A √ó vect A n

def vect.const {A : Type u} (a : A) : ‚àÄ n, vect A n
| Nat.zero   => ‚òÖ
| Nat.succ n => (a, const a n)

def vect.map {A : Type u} {B : Type v} (f : A ‚Üí B) :
  ‚àÄ {n : ‚Ñï}, vect A n ‚Üí vect B n
| Nat.zero   => Œª _ => ‚òÖ
| Nat.succ n => Œª v => (f v.1, map f v.2)

def transport {A : Type u} (B : A ‚Üí Type v) {a b : A} (p : a = b) : B a ‚Üí B b :=
by { induction p; apply id }

/-
type mismatch at LCNF application
  map f _x.12
argument f has type
  B ‚Üí A
but is expected to have type
  A ‚Üí A
-/
def vect.subst {A B : Type u} (p : A = B) (f : B ‚Üí A) {n : ‚Ñï} (v : vect A n) :
  vect.map f (transport (vect ¬∑ n) p v) = vect.map (f ‚àò transport id p) v :=
by { induction p; apply Id.refl }

I think these bugs are being reported on GitHub, see https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/270676-lean4/topic/LCNF.20local.20context.20contains.20unused.20local.20variable.20declaratio/near/301102923
@Leonardo de Moura Someone found a "mixing types and data" issue :)
Pushed a fix for this issue. Great example for the test suite. Thanks for posting it.

It seems that‚Äôs not all. Even after fix this definition still reports a weird error:

type mismatch at LCNF application
  contrRespectsEquiv _x.5 _x.8
argument _x.5 has type
  (_ : (_ : B) √ó lcErased = lcErased ‚Üí (_ : B) √ó lcErased = lcErased) √ó
    ((_ : (_ : B) √ó lcErased = lcErased ‚Üí (_ : B) √ó lcErased = lcErased) √ó
        ((_ : B) √ó lcErased = lcErased ‚Üí lcErased = lcErased)) √ó
      (_ : (_ : B) √ó lcErased = lcErased ‚Üí (_ : B) √ó lcErased = lcErased) √ó
        ((_ : B) √ó lcErased = lcErased ‚Üí lcErased = lcErased)
but is expected to have type
  (_ : Sigma (Types.Id lcErased) ‚Üí (_ : B) √ó lcErased = lcErased) √ó
    ((_ : (_ : B) √ó lcErased = lcErased ‚Üí Sigma (Types.Id lcErased)) √ó
        (Sigma (Types.Id lcErased) ‚Üí lcErased = lcErased)) √ó
      (_ : (_ : B) √ó lcErased = lcErased ‚Üí Sigma (Types.Id lcErased)) √ó
        ((_ : B) √ó lcErased = lcErased ‚Üí lcErased = lcErased)

Here‚Äôs another MWE:

namespace MWE

universe u v w

inductive Id {A : Type u} : A ‚Üí A ‚Üí Type u
| refl {a : A} : Id a a

attribute [eliminator] Id.casesOn

infix:50 (priority := high) " = " => Id

def contr (A : Type u) := Œ£ (a : A), ‚àÄ b, a = b

def singl {A : Type u} (a : A) :=
Œ£ b, a = b

def Corr (A : Type u) (B : Type v) :=
Œ£ (R : A ‚Üí B ‚Üí Type w), (‚àÄ a, contr (Œ£ b, R a b)) √ó (‚àÄ b, contr (Œ£ a, R a b))

def Homotopy {A : Type u} {B : A ‚Üí Type v} (f g : ‚àÄ x, B x) :=
‚àÄ (x : A), f x = g x
infix:80 " ~ " => Homotopy

def isQinv {A : Type u} {B : Type v} (f : A ‚Üí B) (g : B ‚Üí A) :=
(f ‚àò g ~ id) √ó (g ‚àò f ~ id)

def Qinv {A : Type u} {B : Type v} (f : A ‚Üí B) :=
Œ£ (g : B ‚Üí A), isQinv f g

def Qinv.eqv (A : Type u) (B : Type v) :=
Œ£ (f : A ‚Üí B), Qinv f

def linv {A : Type u} {B : Type v} (f : A ‚Üí B) :=
Œ£ (g : B ‚Üí A), g ‚àò f ~ id

def rinv {A : Type u} {B : Type v} (f : A ‚Üí B) :=
Œ£ (g : B ‚Üí A), f ‚àò g ~ id

def biinv {A : Type u} {B : Type v} (f : A ‚Üí B) :=
linv f √ó rinv f

def Equiv (A : Type u) (B : Type v) : Type (max u v) :=
Œ£ (f : A ‚Üí B), biinv f
infix:25 " ‚âÉ " => Equiv

axiom ax‚ÇÅ {A : Type u} {B : Type v} : A ‚âÉ B ‚Üí contr A ‚Üí contr B
axiom ax‚ÇÇ {A : Type v} {B : Type u} (f g : A ‚Üí B) : (Œ£ x, f x = g x) ‚âÉ (Œ£ x, g x = f x)
axiom ax‚ÇÑ {A : Type u} {B : Type v} (w : Qinv.eqv A B) (b : B) : contr (Œ£ a, b = w.1 a)
axiom ax‚ÇÉ {A : Type u} (a : A) : contr (singl a)

def corrOfQinv {A : Type u} {B : Type v} : Qinv.eqv A B ‚Üí Corr A B :=
by { intro w; exists (Œª a b => b = w.1 a); apply Prod.mk <;> intro x;
     apply ax‚ÇÅ; apply ax‚ÇÇ; apply ax‚ÇÉ; apply ax‚ÇÑ }

It‚Äôs interesting also that if we replace last definition (corrOfQinv) with theorem, it will report other error:

application type mismatch
  ?m.23082 = Sigma.fst w a
argument
  Sigma.fst w a
has type
  B : Type v
but is expected to have type
  ?m.23103 a b : Type u_1
Pushed a fix for the LCNF error.
I have added the example to the test suite.

These (new) errors seem to be related to the previous:

namespace MWE

inductive Id {A : Type u} : A ‚Üí A ‚Üí Type u
| refl {a : A} : Id a a

attribute [eliminator] Id.casesOn

infix:50 (priority := high) " = " => Id

def symm {A : Type u} {a b : A} (p : a = b) : b = a :=
by { induction p; exact Id.refl }

def transportconst {A B : Type u} : A = B ‚Üí A ‚Üí B :=
by { intros p x; induction p; exact x }

def transportconstInv {A B : Type u} (e : A = B) : B ‚Üí A :=
transportconst (symm e)

/-
type mismatch at LCNF application
  Id.refl
argument x has type
  B
but is expected to have type
  A
-/
def transportconstOverInv {A B : Type u} (p : A = B) :
  ‚àÄ x, transportconst (symm p) x = transportconstInv p x :=
by { intro x; apply Id.refl }

/-
type mismatch at `MWE.transportconstInv'`, value has type
  (A B : Type u) ‚Üí A = B ‚Üí B ‚Üí B
but is expected to have type
  {A B : Type u} ‚Üí A = B ‚Üí B ‚Üí A
-/
def transportconstInv' {A B : Type u} : A = B ‚Üí B ‚Üí A :=
transportconst ‚àò symm

It‚Äôs strange, but the following isn‚Äôt working now, while previous example works.

namespace MWE

inductive Id {A : Type u} : A ‚Üí A ‚Üí Type u
| refl {a : A} : Id a a

attribute [eliminator] Id.casesOn

infix:50 (priority := high) " = " => Id

def symm {A : Type u} {a b : A} (p : a = b) : b = a :=
by { induction p; exact Id.refl }

def transport {A : Type u} (B : A ‚Üí Type v) {a b : A} (p : a = b) : B a ‚Üí B b :=
by { induction p; exact id }

def transportconst {A B : Type u} : A = B ‚Üí A ‚Üí B :=
transport id

def transportconstInv {A B : Type u} (e : A = B) : B ‚Üí A :=
transportconst (symm e)

def transportconstOverInv {A B : Type u} (p : A = B) :
  ‚àÄ x, transportconst (symm p) x = transportconstInv p x :=
by { intro x; apply Id.refl }

def transportconstInv' {A B : Type u} : A = B ‚Üí B ‚Üí A :=
transportconst ‚àò symm

Fresh problems:

namespace MWE

inductive Id {A : Type u} : A ‚Üí A ‚Üí Type u
| refl {a : A} : Id a a

attribute [eliminator] Id.casesOn

infix:50 (priority := high) " = " => Id

def symm {A : Type u} {a b : A} (p : a = b) : b = a :=
by { induction p; exact Id.refl }

def map {A : Type u} {B : Type v} {a b : A} (f : A ‚Üí B) (p : a = b) : f a = f b :=
by { induction p; apply Id.refl }

def transport {A : Type u} (B : A ‚Üí Type v) {a b : A} (p : a = b) : B a ‚Üí B b :=
by { induction p; exact id }

def boolToUniverse : Bool ‚Üí Type
| true  => Unit
| false => Empty

def ffNeqTt : false = true ‚Üí Empty :=
Œª p => transport boolToUniverse (symm p) ()

def isZero : Nat ‚Üí Bool
| Nat.zero   => true
| Nat.succ _ => false

/-
type mismatch at LCNF application
  ffNeqTt h
argument h has type
  Id Nat lcErased lcErased
but is expected to have type
  Id Bool lcErased lcErased
-/
def succNeqZero (n : Nat) : Nat.succ n = 0 ‚Üí Empty :=
Œª h => ffNeqTt (map isZero h)
